page.title: 18AMBULANCE STATION - BROUGH
page.content: Opened 22.12.66. Now a 24hr. station. Previously run from, and now sharing with, Hessle and serving the whole of Humberside. Manned by 7 men, and 1 woman.Training takes some 3 years and includes driving. Uniforms provided, also home telephones for 'on call' week working 3p.m. to 11p.m. at the station and 11p.m. to 7a.m. on standby 3 ambulances equipped with piped oxygen, suction pipes for clearing blocked airways, inflatable splints, multi_position stretchers and scoop stretchers, also Entinox an analgesic for self_administration. 8a.m._5p.m. all ambulances in use covering emergencies and 'out_patients'. After 5p.m. the service is for emergencies only. In over 99% of call-outs the ambulance arrives within 20 minutes. Every 5 years men are sent on a week's training course.
